commits.message: As hands have teleported, hands are not in good state but UpdateHandStatistics needs to be called to allow finger strength to update. Change to "if tracked"

issue.title: VectorHand - OverflowException: Value was either too large or too small for an Int16.

comment.body: Still not fixed? It occurs when I try to encode a replicated hand via PostProcessor.

pull_request.title: force hand scale for 1 second after hand is found
pull_request.body:
## Summary

When using the Hand Binder, this forced the scale to be immediately changed for the first 1 second after the hand begins tracking to avoid slow scaling from large or small hands

commits.message: add ignorecollisions code for when throwing objects
change bone stiffness when grabbing to smooth out jitter when grabbing

Remove need for fixed timesteb being 0.011111

issue.title: Android architecture warning
issue.body:
In our case, we only use Ultrealeap on Windows, not on Android.

The Android build is done with Mono and not IL2CPP to avoid certain restrictions of AOT in terms of loading assemblies dynamically.

Could it be possible to configure with some setting to avoid this warning every time we build or something like that? It is quite annoying.

Thanks!

comment.body:
Ah, I understand you now

I have made a [Pull Request](https://github.com/ultraleap/UnityPlugin/pull/1518) to address this as a feature, the team will review, test and release when we have capacity to :)

Ensure LeapXRServiceProvider default offset is set to correct values …

issue.title: Android architecture warning
issue.body:
In our case, we only use Ultrealeap on Windows, not on Android.

The Android build is done with Mono and not IL2CPP to avoid certain restrictions of AOT in terms of loading assemblies dynamically.

Could it be possible to configure with some setting to avoid this warning every time we build or something like that? It is quite annoying.

Thanks!

comment.body:
We are not understanding each other.

I am building from a Windows machine (although this is not relevant to the problem) with target to Android with Mono + ARM V7 (32 bit).

As you see in your code, I get a warning because I am not using IL2CPP + ARM64.

But as I say in our case we are not using Ultraleap to target Android (we use native hand tracking) we are using it only when targeting Windows so I would like that this warning dialog was not so invasive and could be configured not to appear.

Thank you.

pull_request.title: Ensure LeapXRServiceProvider default offset is set to correct values …
